intro: Aeschynomene stipulosa, commonly known as slenderleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with slender, erect stems. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemate inflorescences, and it produces linear, dehiscent pods containing several seeds. Aeschynomene stipulosa is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine and as forage for livestock.
